availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nicholas T. Braswell (Lyon County, Ky, merchant and hotel keeper)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant and hotel keeper. Smith County, Tennessee, native. Married to Mary J. Hargrave in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on June 25, 1863. Father of Charles Braswell and Ida Braswell. Grocery and boat store owner in Caldwell County in 1850. Employed John Bolton and James Back as grocery keepers in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County 1850. Landlord in Eddyville in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Eddyville in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 327B.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 835.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 416A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 81.
Find A Grave, "N. T. Braswell (1819-1893)," Memorial #6656699, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6656699 (accessed May 18, 2020).
